title: Autostash is a very useful configuration option when using rebase for local changes. Oftentimes, you may need to bring in commits from the upstream branch, but are not ready to commit just yet.

inline_content.Text: Autostash is a very useful configuration option when using rebase for local changes. Oftentimes, you may need to bring in commits from the upstream branch, but are not ready to commit just yet.

title: However, Git does not allow a rebase to start if the working directory is not clean. Autostash to the rescue:

inline_content.Text: However, Git does not allow a rebase to start if the working directory is not clean. Autostash to the rescue:

title:
git config --global rebase.autostash    # one time configuration
git rebase @{u}                         # example rebase on upstream branch

content_resolved.code:
git config --global rebase.autostash    # one time configuration
git rebase @{u}                         # example rebase on upstream branch

title: The autostash will be applied whenever the rebase is finished. It does not matter whether the rebase finishes successfully, or if it is aborted. Either way, the autostash will be applied. If the rebase was successful, and the base commit therefore changed, then there may be a conflict between the autostash and the new commits. In this case, you will have to resolve the conflicts before committing. This is no different than if you would have manually stashed, and then applied, so there is no downside to doing it automatically.

inline_content.Text: The autostash will be applied whenever the rebase is finished. It does not matter whether the rebase finishes successfully, or if it is aborted. Either way, the autostash will be applied. If the rebase was successful, and the base commit therefore changed, then there may be a conflict between the autostash and the new commits. In this case, you will have to resolve the conflicts before committing. This is no different than if you would have manually stashed, and then applied, so there is no downside to doing it automatically.
